累.definition: tired; weary; to strain; to wear out; to work hard

累垮.definition: to collapse; to be worn out; to break down

累墜.definition: variant of 累贅|累赘[lei2 zhui4]

累死累活.definition: to tire oneself out through overwork; to work oneself to death

累犯.definition: to repeatedly commit an offense; repeat offender; habitual criminal; recidivist; recidivism

累累.definition: again and again; innumerable; repeated; riddled with; accumulated

累覺不愛.definition: (lit.) so exhausted (by difficulties in a relationship) that one feels one could never fall in love again (Internet slang); disenchanted with sth

累計.definition: to calculate the running total; cumulative; the total; in total

累贅.definition: superfluous; cumbersome; a burden on sb; a nuisance to sb; to inconvenience; to tie sb down; long-winded (of writing); also pr. [lei2 zhui5]

累趴.definition: tired to the point of dropping
